comments.author: Celeste @ Berrytravels
comments.content:
thank you for sharing this! I have been at a loss on what to do with artichokes, never having grown up with it.. but still wanting to try it coz I want to try cooking everything I can at least once...

It's also fennel season here in aussie, so perfect timing!

comments.author: Jessica
comments.content: Yum those artichokes look amazing, I love the recipe and the photos. Thanks for sharing!

comments.author: Gretchen
comments.content: I wonder if it's possible to make artichoke stock?  They have a weird chemical in them that makes things you drink taste sweet, so I don't think they'd be a good idea in a routine stock, but it might make an interesting stock on its own.  That'd make it less painful to trim so much of them away!

comments.author: siri
comments.content: If it were possible to even find baby artichokes in the markets here in Norway, I would be making this dish tonight. Looks that good!

comments.author: Carla
comments.content: Looks both elegant and as delicious as food could get.  Mmm...

comments.author: Jesse
comments.content:
Baby artichokes love love love to be fried too. I am a huge fan of fennel and would love to include some of the beautiful farmer's market baby fennel. Also, your use of vermouth reminds of working in a french brasserie.

A recommendation to you: Recently, I put together a salad from the book URBAN ITALIAN; it consisted of fennel, white onions, orange zest, juice, extra virgin olive oil and mint. It was simply delicious.

Thanks for your posts.

comments.author: Michael Natkin
comments.content: That salad sounds delightful! It reminds me a little of one I make with orange segments, white onions, olives and lots of flat-leaf parsley.

comments.author: Christie
comments.content: So incredibly delicious!!! I found and tried this recipe over a month ago and have been thinking about it since... so today I typed the ingredients in Google and found the site again! I just had it for lunch and I had to tell you just how much I enjoy it.  Thank you so much for sharing this recipe!! Delicious!
